structure.unit: COUNTIES, CITIES, AND OTHER LOCAL UNITS
COUNTY GOVERNMENT (FISCAL COURTS AND COUNTY COMMISSIONERS)

law.catch_line: Rights, powers, privileges, and immunities of charter county governments.

text.section:
Charter county governments may exercise the constitutional and statutory rights, powers, privileges, immunities, and responsibilities of counties and cities of the highest class within the county:
In effect on the date the charter county government becomes effective;
That may subsequently be authorized for or imposed upon counties and cities of that class; and
That may be authorized for or imposed upon charter counties.

Rights, powers, privileges and immunities exercised by charter county governments pursuant to subsection (1)(a) and (b) of this section shall continue to be authorized for charter county governments notwithstanding repeal or amendment of the statutes upon which they are based unless expressly repealed or amended for charter county governments.

law.history: Created 1990 Ky. Acts ch. 401, sec. 6, effective July 13, 1990.
